    • Constructor Detail

        public DrawFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultFactory

        public static void setDefaultFactory(DrawFactory factory)
        Set a custom draw factory for the current thread. This is a fallback, for operations where usercode can't set a graphics context. Preferably use the rendering hint Drawable.DRAW_FACTORY to set the factory.
        Parameters:
        factory - the custom factory or null to reset/remove the default factory

      • getInstance

        public static DrawFactory getInstance(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Returns the DrawFactory, preferably via a graphics instance. If graphics is null, the current thread local is checked or if it is not set, a new factory is created.
        Parameters:
        graphics - the current graphics context or null
        Returns:
        the draw factory

      • drawShape

        public void drawShape(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics,
                      Shape<?,?> shape,
                      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bounds)
        Convenience method for drawing single shapes. For drawing whole slides, use Sheet.draw(Graphics2D)
        Parameters:
        graphics - the graphics context to draw to
        shape - the shape
        bounds - the bounds within the graphics context to draw to

      • getFontManager

        public DrawFontManager getFontManager(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Return a FontManager, either registered beforehand or a default implementation
        Parameters:
        graphics - the graphics context holding potentially a font manager
        Returns:
        the font manager
